description.narrative:
The Goal of the Capfish/FOSTER project is to improve the socio-economic conditions of the fishing communities and environmental sustainability of the (Western) Tonle Sap Biosphere Reserve (TSBR) through community-centered interventions reaching over 200000 women, men and children in Cambodia.
The Capfish/FOSTER Project led by Oxfam and 14 partners has 3 Objectives:
1.Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have increased access to safe water supply, hygiene and sanitation services2) Vulnerable and poor girls and boys areprovided with increased availability and accessibility to education and can successfully transition through school 3) Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have developed sustainable alternative livelihoods
Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have increased access to safe water supply, hygiene and sanitation services. Working with innovative award winning Social Enterprises such as Wetland Works ( WW) that provides sustainable hygiene and sanitation solution (HPods ) and with Tuek Saat 1001 ( TS) that brings clean andsafe drinking water through its innovative Water Kiosk models (Kiosks ) there will be increased access and adoption of WASH products and services. Activities will be to Identify sites and construct Water Kiosks. Tuek Saat will also Train the local communities in marketing , promotion and maintenance of Water Kiosks in the communes.

participating-org.narrative:
Teuk Saat 1001 enables nearly 800,000 people (including 280K children in the water-in School program) to drink safe water every day. This performance is achieved thanks to the work of 258 local entrepreneurs running water kiosks in 17 Cambodian provinces.
Needs and constraints of target groups and how the action will improve their situation
Teuk Saat 1001 will implement access to safe wateractivities in 2 provinces Battambang and Siem Reap, in 3 districts and 4 communes amongst communities with high poverty levels and strong dependency on fishing in the flooded forest area of the Tonle Sap Basin Reserve, including floating habitations that are generally mobile as well as habitations that are fixed and surrounded by waters during several months.
The project’s target group consists of 8757 households’ members of Community Fisheries. Members of CFis are dependent on dwindling aquatic resources and need to improve their skills and knowledge to diversify their livelihoods; have limited access to investments/technology to scale up productionor meet quality standards; limited access to markets and are constrained by lack of energy sources for activities such as pumping and cold storage. HHs have limited access to clean and safe drinking water and lack access to modern sanitation and waste management systems, leading to widespread prevalence of diarrhea and water-borne diseases. In response to these challenges, the Capfish programwill adopt an integrated, holistic and multi-stakeholder approach to improve the resilience, productivity, and socio-economic conditions of fishing communities as well as the ecological sustainability of the TSBR through community-centred interventions that improve access to safe water and sanitation, enhance education access and quality, and facilitate the development of sustainable alternative livelihoods Specifically, for the access to safe water component members of CFis will develop capacities to become local operators of water, sanitation, and solar energy solutionswith the skills to market, install, operate and maintain these technologies and generate income.
Households from fishing communities will have improved access to clean and safe water and sanitation as a result ofWater Kiosks greater WASH awareness.
Objectives
1. Fishing communities in the Tonle Sap have increased access to safe water supply services. 2. Community entrepreneurs trained in Water Kiosk installation, operation, marketing and provision of services for communities 3. Water Kiosks constructed and equipped with treatment and purification systems to provide clean and safe water to fishing communities in the Tonle Sap.
GOAL: Enable as many people as possible to benefit from safe drinking water to improve their living conditions andto enable inclusive local economic development. VISION: The best solution to improve the health of vulnerable populationis to enable them to drink safe water transferring know- how is more sustainable than giving. MISSION: implement an entrepreneur model enabling vulnerable populations to produce safe drinking water in an independent an sustainable manner.
